title: How to write a capital cursive W - Quora

response.answer_text: A capital cursive W is quite easy to make- it’s pretty much just a normal cursive W, but larger. Some like to add an extra curl before it, and most like to keep it separated from the word, but it’s that simple.  Here’s a W without the curl. And….  Here’s one with! If you’re writing something you would like to add embellishments to, such as calligraphy or signatures, adding a curl before a capital letter is done commonly.

Copperplate:   Spencerian:  (https://ia801409.us.archive.org/30/items/BloserLessonsInOrnamentalPenmanship/Bloser%20-%20Lessons%20in%20Ornamental%20Penmanship.pdf)  Palmer method:  (The Palmer Method of Business Writing)  Modern cursive Ws are listed in the other answer to this question. Sam Fledmin's answer to How do you write a capital cursive W?  There are also other styles, such as Gothic Cursive and Cursive Italic, but those are somewhat more complex to write and typically need an italic or stub nib.
